title: Strictly Come Dancing 2025 contestants : Full cast lineup of celebrities and professional dancers
body_text:
Strictly Come Dancing 2025 is well and truly underway, with all celebrities and their pro partners battling it out to lift the Glitter Ball trophy.
The BBC reality competition series, hosted by Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman, returned this autumn for another year of jaw-dropping routines and emotional journeys for our cohort of famed contestants.
After weeks of build-up, the celebrities finally met their dance partners, with Strictly producers introducing two new faces as part of the professional lineup.
Viewers got to know 25-year-old American dancer Alexis Warr and 30-year-old Aussie dancer Julian Caillon, with the two coming over from Dancing with the Stars.
The long-running reality show has had to shake off a few scandals over the last 12-18 months, and this series certainly hasnâ€™t been without drama either, thanks to injuries, sickness, and late entrants.
Get personalised updates on Strictly
Wake up to find news on your TV shows in your inbox every morning with Metroâ€™s TV Newsletter.
Sign up to our newsletter and then select your show in the link weâ€™ll send you so we can get TV news tailored to you.
So, with Strictly Come Dancing in full swing for another year, letâ€™s run through the couples hoping to waltz their way into your heartsâ€”and who have already danced their last dance.
Lewis Cope & Katya Jones
Emmerdale star Lewis Cope was announced as Kristian Nairnâ€™s replacement after the Game of Thrones actor was forced to drop out of the competition.
The 30-year-old revealed before the competition that he was looking for a dance partner who would â€˜push him,â€™ and joked heâ€™s going to go out of his way to impress judge Shirley Ballas.
Well, heâ€™s definitely going to be getting what he wants, with Katya Jones being revealed as his partner for the next three months.
Katya won the competition in 2017 with her partner Joe McFadden, and finished strongly with her partner Wynne Evans last year, eventually coming 8th.
Lewis said in a statement ahead of his debut: â€˜Iâ€™m so excited to be swapping the Dales for the dance floor and joining this yearâ€™s Strictly Come Dancing. Iâ€™ve always been a fan of the show and cannot wait to get started!â€™
Lewis quickly emerged as an early favourite to take home the Glitter Ball, despite not being part of the original lineup.
Karen Carney & Carlos Gu
Karen Carney was the 14th celebrity to be announced for the new series of Strictly, and sheâ€™s been paired with Carlos, who was benched last series.
This was despite Carlos finishing as a runner-up in 2023, dancing with Molly Rainford, and then finishing sixth with Angela Scanlon in the 2024 series.
Karen was revealed as a Strictly contestant on Vernon Kayâ€™s BBC Radio 2 show, which was guest-hosted by Gary Davies on the day she was announced.
The new BBC dancing star is a former footballer who is now the lead female pundit for both menâ€™s and womenâ€™s football, across TNT and ITV.
On joining Strictly, Karen said in a press release: â€˜It really is a dream come true to be a part of this yearâ€™s Strictly Come Dancing lineup.
â€˜Iâ€™m such a huge fan of the show, and I canâ€™t believe Iâ€™m finally getting the chance to take part. Iâ€™m so excited to meet everyone and get dancing!â€™
Vicky Pattison & Kai Widdrington
Vicky Pattison was the 11th celebrity contestant announced to appear on Strictly 2025, dancing alongside returning pro Kai Widdrington.
Sheâ€™s best known for appearing on Geordie Shore, but has made a name for herself since appearing on the show as a TV personality and presenter.
However, Kai was warned from the off that heâ€™d have a big task on his hands, as Vicky confessed to being a â€˜drinker, not a dancerâ€™, comparing her moves to those of a â€˜drunk auntyâ€™.
On joining Strictly, Vicky commented: â€˜Iâ€™m absolutely buzzing to be part of this yearâ€™s Strictly Come Dancing lineupâ€¦ but Iâ€™d be lying if I said I wasnâ€™t terrified.
â€˜I am not a natural dancer! However, itâ€™s such an amazing opportunity for me to step out of my comfort zone and to challenge myself in a completely new way, and I just really hope I donâ€™t make too much of a fool of myself!â€™
Ellie Goldstein & Vita Coppola
Trailblazing model Ellie Goldstein was the ninth contestant to be announced this year, dancing with Vito Coppola.
Ellie made history in 2023 as the first model with Down syndrome to grace the cover of British Vogue.
She said about joining the Strictly cast: â€˜Itâ€™s a show Iâ€™ve loved watching for so long, and the chance to now be part of it feels like a dream.
â€˜I know itâ€™s going to be challenging, but Iâ€™m ready to do it with the glitter and glamour and make some magic on that dancefloor. Let the Strictly journey begin!â€™
Vito has a stunning record on Strictly, finishing as a runner-up twice and a winner once. In fact, he won the competition with another dancer named Ellie, so the omens are good.
La Voix & AljaÅ¾ Å korjanec
Singer and 2024 RuPaulâ€™s Drag Race UK finalist La Voix was the seventh contestant to slide onto the dance floor, and the drag superstar has been paired with AljaÅ¾ Å korjanec.
On joining Strictly, La Voix said: â€˜Iâ€™ve performed for royalty, RuPaul and Simon Cowell, but nothing fills me with more excitement (and quite a bit of terror) than the thought of dancing in front of millions on live Saturday night TV.
â€˜Strictly is a national institution and I canâ€™t wait to get started. All thatâ€™s left to say is: good luck to my partner! Hereâ€™s hoping they can help me go from La Voix into La Danse.â€™
La Voix is in trusty hands with Slovenian dancer AljaÅ¾, who won the series in 2013 and has made the top 10 every year that heâ€™s been a professional partner.
Last year, he made it all the way to the final with partner Tasha Ghouri.
George Clarke & Alexis Warr
The sixth contestant to twirl into the 2025 ballroom was George Clarke, dancing alongside a newcomer, American dancer Alexis Warr.
George is known as George Clarkey online, where he is a YouTuber and social media star known to millions for his comedy content. He also co-hosts The Useless Hotline podcast.
On joining Strictly, he said: â€˜Never thought Iâ€™d say this, but Iâ€™m doing Strictly! Honestly, Iâ€™ve got no idea what Iâ€™m doing, but Iâ€™m excited to get stuck in and potentially fall over a fair bit.â€™
Hailing from Utah, Alexis joined Strictly from US series Dancing with the Stars, on which she was part of the large dance troupe.
Balvinder Sopal & Julian Caillon
Balvinder Sopal confirmed she was joining Strictly Come Dancing on Good Morning Britain, and second newcomer, Julian Caillon, was also revealed as her partner.
â€˜I canâ€™t stop butterflies. Every time I think about it, they just go,â€™ Balvinder said â€“ the actress is best known for starring as Suki Panesar in EastEnders.
She added in a statement: â€˜Iâ€™ve dabbled [with dance] a little bit. I did ballroom and Latin as a kind of hobby, and I really love it. And I think when youâ€™ve got a passion for something, youâ€™re naturally kind of inclined to enjoy it.
Despite having a little bit of dancing in her past, sheâ€™s admitted: â€˜I donâ€™t know if Iâ€™ll be any good! It is about telling the story with your feet, with your body, and not speaking.â€™
She continued: â€˜So, you know, I wonâ€™t have to learn any lines, which would be great, but itâ€™ll be like learning a new language, I think.â€™
Australian dancer Julian also joins from Dancing With the Stars â€“ however, he comes to Strictly from the Australian version of the long-running reality show.
Alex Kingston & Johannes Radebe
Alex Kingston tuned in from a holiday in Italy to confirm she had signed up for the Strictly Ballroom, and sheâ€™s now found out that sheâ€™ll be dancing with the lovely Johannes Radebe.
The 62-year-old actor, who played River Song on Doctor Who (aka The Doctorâ€™s wife) opposite three Doctors on screen, had been rumoured as a member of the Strictly cast for weeks before
Alex admitted that she had lurched from feeling â€˜excitedâ€™ to feeling â€˜terrifiedâ€™, which means that having a calming presence like Johannes as a partner will be what she needs.
While Johannes has never won Strictly, heâ€™s finished in the top eight in all five of the last editions of the competition, reaching as high as second with John Waite.
Alex said about joining the Strictly cast: â€˜When I saw Sarah Hadland performing last year, I just thought, sheâ€™s done it, and not only has she done it, she went all the way.
â€˜I reached out and asked her what her experience was, and she was really honest with me about how hard it is, how overwhelming it can be, but also how it absolutely changed her life.â€™
Amber Davies & Nikita Kuzmin
After Dani Dyer was forced to drop out of the contest after breaking her ankle, the BBC announced Love Island star Amber Davies would be replacing her.
Amber is competing now with Daniâ€™s professional dance partner, Nikita Kuzmin.
In a statement, Amber said: â€˜This has been the craziest 24 hours of my life. Iâ€™ve watched Strictly with my family since I was younger, and to now be part of the show is a dream come true.
â€˜Iâ€™m going to give it my all, and I am sending Dani well wishes for a speedy recovery. I hope I do her proud.â€™
The late addition couple quickly became favourites among viewers, earning high scores from the judges too from the offf, despite having just a day to rehearse their first routine.
Also, if youâ€™re sad about Dani having to drop out, there have been hints that her Strictly days arenâ€™t totally behind her.
Harry Aikines-Aryeetey & Karen Hauer
Olympian and star of BBCâ€™s Gladiators, Harry Aikines-Aryeetey, was the first famous face confirmed to be gracing the Strictly ballroom this autumn.
The TV personality already took part in last yearâ€™s Strictly Come Dancing Christmas Special with pro-partner Nancy Xu, and now he is back for round two.
This time, heâ€™s been partnered with Karen Hauer, with Nancy on the bench after finishing ninth with Shayne Ward last year.
Speaking about joining Strictly, Harry said: â€˜After the Christmas Special, it was so nice I just had to do it twice! Iâ€™m so excited to be part of the Strictly family this series, and Iâ€™m ready to give it all Iâ€™ve got.
â€˜Iâ€™ll be bringing tons of energy to light up the dance floor. Letâ€™s hope Iâ€™m as quick at picking up the routines as I am on the track,â€™ he said in a statement.
The multi-gold-medal-winning Team GB sprinter was announced as Nitro in the high-stakes BBC gameshow in 2023, hosted by Bradley and Barney Walsh.
Who has left Strictly so far?
Thomas Skinner & Amy Dowden
Thomas Skinner was the 10th celebrity contestant confirmed to be part of the show, but the first to be eliminated, alongside his partner Amy Dowden.
The TV personality, social media star and businessman is best known for his appearances on The Apprentice, and was considered quite a controversial pick for the show.
After spending time with American right-wing politician JD Vance, his casting was criticised by others in the media, and things got worse when he had to apologise after allegedly snatching a journalistâ€™s phone during a Strictly press conference.
Meanwhile, Amy returned back on the dancefloor after being forced to retire midway through the competition in 2024.
After being the first duo voted out of this yearâ€™s contest with their Salsa to Bonkers by Dizzee Rascal, Thomas apologised to Amy, saying of his experience: â€˜Iâ€™ve loved it. Iâ€™ve never danced before, and my stay was short, but Amyâ€™s amazing. Itâ€™s been great fun and Iâ€™ve enjoyed it.
â€˜I canâ€™t really dance that well, but Iâ€™ve had fun! Thank you, Amy. Sorry that we havenâ€™t done too good, â€˜cause youâ€™re a different class.â€™
Ross King & Jowita Przystal
Lorraineâ€™s very own US showbiz reporter Ross King and his pro partner Jowita Przystal were the second-eliminated couple during Movie Week.
Ross previously poked fun at his lack of experience and joked about being the favourite to be the first one out.
Alas, their time together was short-lived, having failed to secure the judgesâ€™ backing in the dance-off with their Thunderbirds-inspired Paso Doble.
When asked by Tess about their time on the show, Ross said tearfully: â€˜I have loved every single minute of it. I would like to say thank you to everyone who has supported us, all the people who voted â€“ theyâ€™ve been amazing. I want to thank everyone here in this room, backstage, the judges, the crew â€“ every single person here has made me so, so welcome.â€™
Jowita, who hailed Ross as her â€˜Kingâ€™, also vowed to be â€˜a be a little part of [his] life forever.â€™
Chris Robshaw & Nadiya Bychkova
Former England rugby captain Chris Robshaw was the eighth celeb to join the Strictly Come Dancing 2025 roster.
The sporting icon became captain at 23 years old, earning 66 caps for England and captaining the national team 43 times. In 2016, he led the team to a Six Nations Grand Slam victory.
But sadly, despite pushing himself so far out of his â€˜comfort zoneâ€™ throughout his time on Strictly with pro Nadiya Bychkova, he had an early exit.
Speaking the evening after his elimination, he told It Takes Two host Fleur East: â€˜Of course weâ€™re gutted to be out of the competition, but weâ€™re incredibly proud of what weâ€™ve done and achieved.
â€˜I donâ€™t say this lightly but over the last 24 hours, itâ€™s been extremely emotional.
â€˜The amount of messages weâ€™ve had from friends, family, people on social media. â€˜Itâ€™s been really overwhelming. I actually relate it to retiring from rugby.â€™
Strictly viewers were equally gutted for Nadiya, who hasnâ€™t had much lucj in recent series, having only made it to Blackpool twice in the six years sheâ€™s been a professional dancer.
In 2024, she was dumped out in 15th place, as Tom Dean was the first star eliminated.
Stefan Dennis & Dianne Buswell
Stefan Dennis, whoâ€™s best known for playing Paul Robinson on the popular soap Neighbours, was paired with fellow Aussie and last yearâ€™s winner Dianne Buswell this series.
Dianne and her partner Chris McCausland lifted the trophy in December 2024 after a remarkable campaign that saw her go one better than her runner-up finish with Bobby Brazier.
Alas, actor Stefan, 66, wasnâ€™t able to replicate her success, as their journey together came to an unexpected end after just a few weeks.
The TV icon was forced to withdraw from Strictly due to an injury, just one week after making a comeback when he was given a by due to illness.
A statement released by him at the time read: â€˜I canâ€™t tell you how devastated I am to have to leave so prematurely.
â€˜There has been, and still is, so much love and support from everyone for both Dianne and myself. I owe both the Strictly family and Dianne a massive debt of gratitude for giving me the opportunity to fulfil my dream of being able to dance with my wife. (When my leg is better).â€™
Ever the joker, he added a note that made Neighbours fans smile: â€˜Fun fact for all the avid Neighbours fansâ€¦ itâ€™s the same leg! ðŸ˜‚â€™
Dianne, of course, made Strictly history this time as the first dancer in the history of the competition to take to the floor while pregnant, as she expects a baby boy with boyfriend Joe Sugg.
Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink & Lauren Oakley
Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink was the first big shock elimination of the series following a surprise dance-off against Amber and Nikita during Icons Week, in which Jimmy paid tribute to Prince.
He and his pro partner, Lauren Oakley, danced their Purple Rain American Smooth for a second time but, unfortunately, the judges unanimously voted to save theatre star Amber.
Speaking after the decision was made, Jimmy said he had â€˜absolutely lovedâ€™ his time on the dancefloor, adding: â€˜I can only say thank you very much for letting me have this experience and to my daughters for pushing me to come here and do this.â€™
He also thanked his partner: â€˜Most importantly, [to Lauren] this girl, she is just absolutely incredible.
â€˜She has been absolutely amazing with me. [To Lauren] You are a diamond.â€™
More Trending
Jimmy is famously an ex-football pro. He played for clubs including Leeds United, AtlÃ©tico Madrid, and Chelsea, carving out a prolific goal-scoring career in the Premier League and across Europe.
Since retiring, Jimmy has been both a football pundit and a football manager, and was last in charge of Burton Albion as of 2022.
